Name: Battle of Cajamarca, 1532
Description:
Battle of Cajamarca, 1532 depicts the climactic “battle” between Pizarro’s conquistadors and the cream of the Incan empire.

In spite of being outnumbered 40 to 1, the Spaniards are the heavy favorite to win. But victory is not a foregone conclusion, and you’ll need to employ good strategy to emulate the historical result. Comes with 10 pages of rules, 6" x 9" map, 80 counters.

Published in Panzerschreck magazine #19

Name: Paths to Aegis
Description:
Paths to Aegis is an automa rogue-lite deck-building board game. The game allows for 1-4 player cooperation as each player takes their own character with a unique set of abilities and strengths as they discover new tiles on their way to defeat Cerberus by gaining more powerful cards and leveling up.

Each turn the player rolls the die to move across the board or rolls the die if they're in battle. Rolling a 1 or a 2 places them in battle. Once a player is in battle, life clips keep track of health for both the player and each enemy they fight in battle.

While in battle, a player will use as many action cards as levels they are and use those actions to either damage the enemy or heal their health. On the enemy's turn to attack, the player must roll the die. Each enemy has a standard attack and most have a special attack. If the die roll matches the enemy's special attack, then it usually damages the player more than a standard attack. Once the enemy has been defeated, players earn coins which they can use to either purchase more action cards at the market or level up.

As it is a rogue-lite game, you can expect to die. But don't worry! Upon death, you only lose half your coins and you keep any cards you purchased.

Name: Legendary: A Marvel Deck Building Game – Marvel Studios' Guardians of the Galaxy
Description:
In space, the rule of law is more of a loose guideline, so someone has to guard the galaxy. As your adventure unfolds, recruit the well-meaning but questionable methods of the Guardians of the Galaxy to fight by your side against galactic threats, like Ronan the Accuser! This new exciting Marvel Cinematic Universe Legendary expansion features characters from the first and second Guardians of the Galaxy movies. Ride across the Legendary cosmos with these mighty misfits in your hand.

This expansion includes 5 Heroes, 2 new Masterminds and Villain groups and requires a Marvel Legendary Core Set to play. This expansion is ideal to join the Marvel Studios Phase 1 Base Set.

—description from the publisher

Name: Roll 'n' GOL
Description:
Anything goes for your team to WIN!
What happens on the court is solved at the table.
Predict and change the results in your favor!
You don't need to know football to play.

A fun and dynamic game ideal for soccer lovers!

In Roll 'n' GOL you are going to simulate a soccer world cup, but living it from the table!

Each player will have a sheet where he will write down who, according to him, will win the World Cup, how the games will go, the number of goals and fouls, among other things.

The results of the matches will be given with dice rolls and each player will be able, at the cost of points, to use his special abilities to change the result of the matches.

Try to get your teams to the final! But don't forget to make life miserable for your rivals' teams!

At the end of the championship, the player who obtains the most points in his checkbook wins the game, correctly predicting the results of the matches. Points can be earned by using stars, inventing goals or penalties, or even having the game replayed.


Components:

     block of sheets
     2 Dice
     1 schematic card
     15 team cards
     rulebook



Super Estadio second edition includes a large box so you can store all the game's expansions.

Name: Code Crackers
Description:
Code Crackers is a two-player card game that encourages players to utilize critical thinking, deductive reasoning, and code-cracking intuition to beat their opponent before getting their own codes cracked.

The beginning of the game moves quickly with players attempting to obtain the smallest inkling of what their opponent's code might be. Players will record their opponent's answers to their questions on their dry-erase Reference Cards.  As the game progresses, gameplay becomes less about asking questions and more about deductive reasoning and critical thinking to crack your opponent's 3, 4, and 5-digit codes. The first player to crack the code wins.

Code Crackers is exhilarating for all ages (Given that they can add numbers between 0 and 10!)

Name: CARU UTA (狩歌)
Description:
With CARU UTA (ç‹©æ­Œ) as long as a song contains Japanese lyrics, you can start playing a game of Karuta. A whole new way to appreciate your favorite tunes.

1) Spread the word cards onto a table or flat surface so that they are easily visible by all players.

2) Play a J-pop song of your choice. Or sing it yourself.â€¨â€¨

3) Be the quickest player to claim a word card that matches the lyrics of the song.

Some word cards have a higher point value than others. Other cards and combinations will get you additional points.

After three songs have been played, the player with the most points wins the game.

Name: Goblin Cave
Description:
Goblin Cave is an asymmetrical team-based tactics game featuring strategic, card-based combat driven by unique character abilities and player decisions.

Each player takes control of two unique characters, drawing cards with powerful abilities and moving freely around the board. Players will control tactical locations, place traps, launch fireballs, destroy walls, teleport across pits, climb ledges, sling arrows, swing great-axes, steal relics, and much, much more!

Each team of players has their own win conditions, and will go toe-to-toe with their opponents to achieve them through fast-paced strategy-fueled combat. Adventurers traverse the Goblins’ cave in order to steal Relics—objects of great arcane power. Goblins must defend their homes from the greedy invaders who are trying to steal their relics, navigating the cave through tunnels only they can use! Each team is comprised of unique characters with rich lore and powerful specialized abilities, not unlike a board game version of a MOBA (like League of Legends) or hero shooter (like Overwatch or Apex Legends).

Players control two characters simultaneously. On a player’s turn, they draw an ability card from each character's ability deck, roll a die for each character’s movement, then move and use an ability card for each character, in any order they wish. The game ends either when all characters on a team are incapacitated, when the Adventurers escape with a relic, or when 10 rounds have passed.

With 10 playable characters, multiple cave maps, and several planned expansions, Goblin Cave offers a great deal of replayability and long-term support.

Name: Ghost Out (ゴーストアウト)
Description:
Ghost Out is an abstract game where players cast ghosts at each other. The first player to chase out all the ghosts from his or her area is the winner. On their turn, players chose whether to cast a ghost from either their own area or a shared area space. Ghosts can be casted in any diagonal direction.

When casting, a player will pick up all ghosts currently on that area space. The player then choses a direction and puts one ghost marker on each space proceeding straight in that direction until they have used up all the ghost markers.

If a player finishes casting and the last ghost marker lands in his or her own Safe Area, the player may take this single ghost marker and place it off the board to be used for Reincarnation.

After finishing this Capture step, the player may then choose whether to use Reincarnation or Store. By using Reincarnation, the player will draw a card with a bonus written on it. Reincarnation rewards the player with a bonus but if the player Stores their captured ghosts, they can trigger an even bigger Reincarnation bonus later in the game.

The bonus enables the player to cast again and chase away more ghosts from their area. However, players should be careful not to chase away too many ghosts which could result in limited choices. Instead, they should strategize to chain the bonus events together so that they can win in one fell swoop. At the end of a round, remove any ghosts that remain in either player’s Safe Area.

Name: Hrou dobrým motoristou
Description:
Czech board game about road traffic. The game was to teach children the rules of the road.

Each player has their own car on the game board - dice and tokens (money) are used to play, which are used to pay fines for violating the rules of the road.

Interesting fact: 
The official rules of the game also provide a basic overview of road traffic signs.
The preface to the rules was written by the Ministry of Emergency Security

Basic course of the game:
It is played on a game board that shows the road (which has a clearly defined start and finish) and each player has his own figure (in the shape of a race car), which moves around the playing area. To move around the board, players roll the dice (three dice with numbers 1 to 6). At the beginning of the game, players roll the dice - the player with the highest total starts and then the others according to the sum on the dice.
Subsequently, the players take turns - everyone rolls the dice on their turn - and according to the sum on the dice, they move on the playing field towards the goal with the toy car.

The game board shows the roads, including traffic signs - for example:

     Main road in front of the intersection - the player can continue without interruption
     Side road in front of the intersection - you are on a side road and you have to pass all the vehicles on the main road - so deduct 2 points from your roll of the dice for the delay at the intersection.
     Prohibition of overtaking - in corners or marked places, players may not overtake the vehicles of other players in front of them - they must follow them, even if they threw a larger number of points on the dice. It is possible to overtake only after the end of the overtaking ban.
     Traffic light - the game contains a dice that has colors on the sides - red, yellow and green. When a player arrives at the intersection square with a traffic light, he must roll this dice and may not continue until he is green.
     Speed â€‹â€‹limit - a player who moves in this part of the road counts only half the value of his dice roll.
     No stop sign - if a player ends his turn on this square, he must pay one coin fine.


The game also contains red wooden chips that represent money. At the beginning of the game, the players distribute them evenly. When playing, the places where fines are paid are defined - for example, No stop sign.

The winner is the player who reaches the finish line first and at the same time has at least one more money - so he did not spend everything on fines.

Name: Order Pizza-la
Description:
Become a pizza chef and compete to collect pizza cards to complete your pizza. Each card has 1 of 6 kinds of ingredients and 1 of 8 kinds of alphabet keys.
In each round, the turn player flips a black card to reveal the alphabet key for that round, and all players get the card with that key at the same time.
At the end of the 8 rounds, you will have an 8-piece pizza.
You will score if you meet one of the two orders and complete the pizza with a particular type of piece. You win by getting the most points.

—user summary

Name: Mullewapp: Das große Wettrennen
Description:
An animal race for 2-4 players from 4 years. Pig Waldemar, Franz von Hahn and Johnny Mauser with sheep Wolke against farm dog Bello. Who will reach the farm first? Each animal has its own lane. In the cooperative variant, dice are rolled - for the animal dice, one of the animals is drawn one step accordingly, then for the symbol dice, an animal tile of the back is revealed and the animal is drawn, everyone remembers the animal to be able to draw a desired animal later. If all animals are at the finish line before Bello, everyone wins together. For the competitive variant, each player is assigned one of the four friends, and the first animal at the finish line wins.

—user summary

Name: Das Bachspiel
Description:
The Bachspiel is a fishing game with didactic information about the creatures in streams with high to low water quality. In the game, players use magnetic fishing hooks to fish for previously prepared animals or trash from cardboard boxes from behind a screen and receive points if they can match the animals to the correct water quality. No points are awarded for trash. The player with the most points wins.

—user summary

Name: Чемпионы Мидгарда. Вальхалла и Тёмные горы
Description:
Two expansions in one box.

Champions of Midgard: Valhalla - The glorious dead gains the favors of the Valkyrie to help you win

Champions of Midgard: The Dark Mountains - Battle Bergrisars and recruit the Archer clansmen in the dark mountains

Name: Crypt of the Worlock
Description: Crypt of the Worlock is an homage to the microgames of the 70s and 80s in which one or more players take on the role of a wizard, warrior, dwarf, healer, and thief to raid a litch's lair.

Name: Wolfpack
Description:
Kill (collect) as many sheep and strange wolves as possible. And don't always just be nice - this is how you get to victory faster.

Cards are drawn one after the other from the flock of sheep. As soon as the action cards are used, the game gets really exciting.

The game ends. when all strange wolves are eliminated or there are no more sheep on the table that can be picked up.



Reisse (sammle) so viele Schafe und fremde Wölfe wie möglich. Und dabei nicht immer nur nett sein - so kommt man schneller zum Sieg. Es wird der Reihe nach Karten aus der Schafherde gezogen. Sobald die Actionkarten eingesetzt werden, bekommt das Spiel so richtig Spannung. Zudem ist das Spiel hochwertig verpackt und erstklassig designt. Empfohlen ab 10 Jahren empfohlen und für 2 - 5 Spieler.

Name: Wer versteckt sich hier... im Dschungel?
Description: Players should find one of the 8 animals on an animal card on a jungle map with 11 animals. Whoever finds the animal gets to keep the animal card, and the next animal card and jungle card are revealed. Whoever collects the most animal cards wins the game. There are 3 other very similar game suggestions in the game rules.

Name: Publicity
Description: Rush through town and try to do the shopping as soon as possible. But be careful, there are other people out and about in the city and they try to slow you down. Use your cards cleverly and hinder your fellow players. Get to the finish line first.

Name: Roll Camera!: The B-Movie Expansion
Description:
Congrats, filmmaker!

Your career is finally finding its footing, thanks to your determination, luck, and more than a few questionable scripts. While other filmmakers burden themselves with “important” movies that have “big” budgets and are “good,” YOU are wisely blazing a trail in the opposite direction: the B-Movie! Yes, the B-movie - low on budget, but high on thrills, chills, and bloody spills. This may not be the glamorous side of Hollywood but if you roll your dice right, it could still be profitable!

This time around, you'll have access to new roles and specialized equipment to help you get the job done. But your responsibility to produce a watchable film is as demanding as ever! Your movies now have unique genre requirements: crime, fantasy, horror, sci-fi, western -- or some kind of mixed-up genre soup combination. The whole thing is causing more disorganization and chaos than ever before...

There's even less time to waste - Roll Camera!!

Name: Goetia: The Card Game
Description:
Goetia the Card Game is a quick, easy to play game for 2-4 players where the aim of the game is to be victorious in pitting the Ars Goetia Demons against one another in a battle of wills as well as brawn.

Will you be able to strategically thrust your Demons into the fray at the most opportune moment when they're at their most powerful? Or risk summoning them early when they're weaker in case you lose control of them and are forced to use them? And will you have the Seals at hand to make sure your Demons are boosted, or enable you to banish your opponent's Demons that threaten your victory? Luck will certainly play a big part when largely uncontrollable entities are involved, but Demonic victory will depend on how well you play the hand you're dealt.

On a turn each player will play cards & also metal tokens (seals).
It's played over 3-6 rounds (depending on number of players).
The player with the highest points score at the end of the rounds wins.

Name: Dice Drop
Description:
Awards & Recognitions:
2021 Solitaire Print and Play Contest

     11th Best easy build
     12th Best game by a new solo designer
     13th Best game designed within the contest timeframe
     14th Best low ink printing


Strategically drop the dice into the 6x7 grid and make shapes to gain points in this free arcade-inspired 1-sheet print-and-play game by first-time designer, Clint Ghosn.

How to Play
1. Take dice from the dice bag and roll. 
2. Place the dice on their corresponding columns while using power-ups to mitigate your roll. 
3. Drop all dice in the grid and score any shapes you matched

Do this for 3 rounds of increasing difficulty aimed to emulate fast-paced arcade gameplay.

Name: Britain's Battle of the Bulge: Elsenborn Ridge
Description:
Soon after the 16 December 1944 German attack in the Ardennes, British troops began moving into position for a counter-attack. By late December the British XXX Corps was heavily involved in helping push back the German Sixth Panzer Army, advancing alongside the Americans to erase all German gains by early January.

The Battle of the Bulge is rightly celebrated as an American victory; most troops involved were Americans, and most casualties likewise were Americans. But the British Army fought as well, and we celebrate their victories over fascism as well.

Requires Elsenborn Ridge and Liberation 1944 to play all of the scenarios.
Families: History: World War II (Battle of the Bulge)

Name: 2 Nun 2 Run (fan expansion for Nuns on the Run)
Description:
A revamp on the beloved classic from 2010, 2 Nun 2 Run adds a new map and extra goal cards to this hidden movement chase game.

Up to 6 novices must sneak through an all-new abbey, to find their heart's desire. The novices must remain watchful for the Abbess or Prioress, who are on patrol to ensure no mischief is wrought.

In 2020, Frederic Moyersoen uploaded files for the unpublished expansion to Nuns on the Run, canceled when Mayfair Games shut down in 2018. That prototype has now been developed into this print and play expansion.

You will also need from the original game from 2010:
Rule Book, Log Sheets, Novice Tokens, Guard figures, Noise and Vanished Tokens, Captured and Turn Markers, Line of Sight edge, Novice Status and Movement Cards and Guard Movement cards and Blessing Cards.

Name: Nersha
Description:
Nersha — A unique and customizable game of abstract strategy. Relive an ancient tale and lead your people home before they’re lost to the blizzard. 12 maps are included, with millions more to discover.

The goal is to lead 3 of your pieces home before your rival. Players take turns sliding 1 of their pieces across the board. There are no captures or jumps, but players' pieces will keep sliding on open tiles if they move in a direction until they would run into something. When you lead a piece home, that's one less piece on the board to block your rival. Every piece on the board may help or halt your progress.

While Nersha has several board layouts that ship with the game, players can decide to change the board or the number of pieces to play with, among other aspects. There are also seven different tile types that can add more complexity to mapmaking.

This game is designed to bridge between casual or abstract games you learn as a kid with daunting games like chess, bringing together all playstyles.

Name: Space Pirate's Treasure
Description:
Each player controls a pirate ship flying around an asteroid belt trying to find the loot of a long dead pirate captain.

Ideal for multiplayer club games or introducing new people to wargaming, simple to learn and hopefully fun to play.

Turn Sequence:

     Randomly determine the order of play for the turn
     Each player activates their ship in turn 
     Move dust clouds 
     Roll for random events 
     Roll for end of game  


–Description from the publsiher

Name: The Final Light-Year: The Heton Sector
Description:
September 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

You will be taking The Final Lightyear to the Heton Sector where the Spaceport J77 is located. In this sector the Market makes an appearance, so now's your chance to load up on some Burster Bombs. Lurking in this sector is both the Scarab Mother and a Terradact Fighter, so beware!!


Released in the September 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

Name: Food Chain Island: Legendary Creatures
Description:
Get ready, we're headed back to Food Chain Island! You will be meeting Legendary Creatures! What makes these legendary creatures so legendary? Well, for one they're mythical creatures! On the island you'll see a Phoenix for the first time. These creatures stay hidden and can not be eaten until they are face up. Also, a legendary animal has its power activated when it is eaten.

The legendary animals are unique in two ways:


     First, they start hidden. A legendary animal cannot be eaten until it is face-up. When an animal is eaten orthogonally adjacent to a legendary animal, then it is flipped face-up. It can then be eaten.



     Second, a legendary animal has its power activated when it is eaten. It does not have a special ability that activates when it eats. The animal that eats the legendary animal will also have its effect active, and you must fulfill both effects.


In addition, some of the numbers included in this expansion already exist in the base game. Animals of the same number cannot eat one another, unless they have an ability that allows them to do so.

Name: Five Parsecs From Home: Trailblazer's Toolkit
Description:
You are knee-deep in radioactive dust on some colony-world nobody has ever heard of, there are Precursor marines sniping at you whenever you stick your head up and the nano-comms are completely scrambled.

The Trailblazer’s Toolkit is here to help you out!

The first expansion for the RPG-Lite adventure wargame Five Parsecs From Home 3rd edition gives you 58 pages packed full of new options to customize your game and the way you play.

Players get an introductory 4 turn campaign perfect for getting a soft start on the game or introducing a friend, more narrative content with random tables will generate the names of starships, planets, colonies and corporate patrons, two different systems for progressively increasing the difficulty of the campaign as you play, a unique scenario and set-up sequence for player vs player battles and a co-op scenario.

We’ve also dialed up the adversaries, AI variations add unpredictability and a wider array of possible actions to each type of enemy.

–Description from the publisher

Name: Temporal Odyssey 2
Description:
A battle card game about dueling Time Travelers! This is a stand-alone sequel to the original Temporal Odyssey.

Draft cards from the Past, Present, and future decks and enlist epic characters to banish the other Traveler from the timeline!  Each time period has its own theme and mechanics, and each class has specific uses and value depending on the situation and your Traveler's needs. Each card you draft provides elemental power. Collecting certain elements will level up your Traveler's spells, enabling power plays that can shift the pace of a fight dramatically. Each Traveler uses each element differently, and can greatly affect how you prioritize your drafting and banning.

Banishing enemy characters, securing artifacts, and defeating rival Travelers will destabilize your opponent's timeline, but also grant them more power. Once their stability is lost, defeat their Traveler one final time to win!

The game ends when you defeat the enemy Traveler after they have 3+ instability cards.

Name: GIRI game
Description:
GIRI Game is a storytelling card game for children that develops communications skills, imagination and emotional intelligence. GIRI Game helps children improve their attention span. Some kids have shorter attention spans because of too much 'screen time'. Through playing GIRI card game and telling stories with set elements, children improve their focus, learn to express their thoughts and ideas fully, and improvise in the moment.

There are two roles in the game:
The Storyteller, team or player who tells the story.
The Teaser, team or player that distract the Storyteller by inserting their oen card into the course of the story.

Each Teaser team/Player draws one card from the Teaser Category. The drawn cards are not shown to the Storyteller.
Storyteller starts to tell a story, based on cards from categories: Characters, Objects, Theme, Place, Atmosphere.

As the Storyteller tells a story, the Teaser team tries to distract the Storyteller or change the way the story is told.
Each Teaser team shall do this once, whenever they want to during the story. The Storyteller has to stay focused on his story... And include Teaser cards in it.

The winner is the one who scores the most points in all rounds of the game. The maximum possible score in each round is 12. A maximum of 6 points is obtained for technical difficulty of the story and a maximum of 6 points for artistic impression.

Name: Schweizer Reise
Description:
You can feel the ice-cold wind on your face. Snow is crunching under your feet. The panorama is simply amazing. You are standing on Jungfraujoch and looking out over Switzerland – it is a feeling like no other! You quickly take a picture before continuing on with your tour of Switzerland. There is so much to discover. In Broc you want to see Maison Cailler, the famous Swiss chocolaterie, and you plan to visit the Olympic Museum in Lausanne. And perhaps you will be lucky enough to snap a picture of an ibex in the national park! But unfortunately your holidays will soon be over. Only those who plan well manage to see as much of Switzerland as they can before the holidays officially come to an end. You obviously also need a bit of luck on this kind of trip. An exciting game for all Switzerland enthusiasts.

Aim of the game
You are exploring Switzerland with a small group of travellers. Your three travellers start in different cities in Switzerland: one starts in German-speaking Switzerland (in Basel), one starts in Ticino (in Mendrisio) and one starts in Western Switzerland (in Geneva). You win the game if you score the most points with your three travellers. To earn points, your travellers have to reach as many destinations as possible, go on discovery tours and take pictures of attractions.

How to play
The youngest player is the tour guide and is responsible for managing the calendar during the game. The youngest player begins the game and takes a turn. A turn means they 1) roll the dice and reroll and 2) perform the roll results. After a turn, the next player takes their turn going anticlockwise, and so on. Every time the tour guide takes their turn, a new day of travel begins. The tour guide moves the calendar marker forward to the next day.

Name: GUATAFAMILY 'the family edition of Guatafac'
Description:
The game of imagination and mental agility to laugh with your family :)

Answer in less than 8 seconds to questions of all kinds: family, school, moments, laughs ...

Win points by answering correctly to each card. The one who answers more questions corrrectly and has more points at the end of the game wins :)

A game to play from 8 years to 99, adapted to the family. Play in 15 to 60 min, 3 to 10 players and millions of possible answers.
Cards printed in the European Union on paper from sustainably managed forests. 1% of the profits are donated to charities.

Name: TV Master
Description: The players move their game pieces via a spiral into the center of media power by rolling the dice. Opposing figures can be hit and reset. On some fields, questions about Austrian TV shows have to be answered. Points are awarded for correctly answered questions, depending on how far you are from the goal. The game ends when a player has reached the goal or all question cards have been distributed. The player with the most points wins.

Name: Swords & Sails: Mercenaries & Privateers
Description:
Mercenaries & Privateers is a card expansion for the Epic Board game, Swords & Sails: Rewrite History in 1000 AD.

The new expansion will Feature 100 new cards, including the Mercenary/Privateer,  Revolt and Calamity/Prosperity categories of intrigue cards.  This will expanded the original deck of 60 intrigue cards and the 4 original categories of Development (Green), Political (Blue), Espionage (Yellow), and War (Red) to 6 Categories adding the Calamity (Grey) and the Prosperity (White) categories.  The new Mercenary and Privateer cards are in the War (Red) category.  Intrigue cards expand the options which Swords & Sails players have during a game and represent many simulated choices which make the game more realistic and very satisfying to play. Intrigue cards are acquired by players during the intrigue phase of the game, with each player gaining at least one card, each turn.

For more details on the original game Swords & Sails, rules, and components, please see the Rules section below.

Name: Jamboree Game
Description:
The Jamboree Game is a roll and move game that sees players move around a winding track with 130 spots.

The board shows a course where players are scouts that trek around the outdoors passing along the way wild animals, a ration dump and Indian camp. Players roll a dice and move the number of spaces indicated by the dice throw. Along the way certain numbered spaces require the player to follow directions written next to the spot. Some will help the player while other spots incur a penalty. First player to reach the last space (130) is declared the winner and ends the game.

Name: Schmetterling
Description:
The players roll a color die and place their stones on same-colored parts of 9 butterflies. Whoever has placed 3 stones on a butterfly takes possession of it. A foreign stone may be exchanged for one of your own stones if you are already represented on the butterfly. Butterflies on which three players are represented are removed from the game. The game ends when only one butterfly is left in the game. The winner is the player who has been able to take possession of the most butterflies.

—user summary

Name: BattleCON: Andrus Dochartaigh Royal Bodyguard
Description:
Andrus fights with two swords, each of which gains a special kind of charge that can boost his attacks. These recharge over time, so Andrus must choose when to exert each burst of power for maximum effect.

Draw your blades and strike out to overwhelm your rivals’ defenses!

Name: BattleCON: Rheye Cal Celestial Sojourner
Description:
Rheye’s talismans act as traps, locking up portions of the board or forcing her opponents to activate their game-changing effects. Though these traps are limited, just a few of them can turn the tide of a battle.

Intimidate opponents as you strike from afar, wielding divine, binding magic to smite your foes!

Name: Sonne, Mond + Sterne
Description: Players draw celestial bodies from a small bag and collect them in front of them. Whoever draws a green celestial body may exchange a celestial body with a fellow player. The green one goes back into the bag. The goal is to collect celestial bodies of the same color. The first player to collect 6 pieces wins the game.

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Taylor & Gus Booster Pack
Description:
Trusted members of the Kingdom’s security, Taylor and Gus often ride on patrols beyond the walls of their safe home to keep borders secure and trade routes with other scattered settlements open.

Contents:

     1x Resin Taylor Model
     1x Resin Gus Model
     11 All Out War Cards including: 2 Survivor Cards, 7 Equipment Cards, 2 Veteran Skill Cards
     8 Call to Arms Cards including: 2 Survivor Cards, 6  Equipment Cards
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: The Walking Dead: All Out War – The Kingdom Guard Booster Pack
Description: Kingdom guards ride to war better equipped than most other survivors. With swords and firearms at their disposal and swift horses to outrun walkers, they make formidable opponents.
Families: Game: The Walking Dead – All Out War

Name: BattleCON: Victor Master of Terror
Description:
Victor’s suggestions help him to control opponents, threatening dangerous disadvantages if they violate his commands. The opponent can only afford to break so many suggestions during a fight, so look for ways to force their hand or put them in an awkward position.

Terrorize opponents with your suggestions, or punish those foolish enough to defy them!

Name: The Movie Movie Game
Description:
In Movie Movie Game, you and your friends test your knowledge of popular movie titles in the stupidest way possible. Movie Movie Game forces its players to bend and twist their brains in ways hitherto unseen by modern humankind. Anyone can name a movie based on a loose outline of its plot, but Movie Movie Game combines titles in such a way that you'll be dying laughing as your friend struggles to find the right way to say "Saving Private RyAnnihilation." Pro-tip: The trick is to really let them squirm.

The basic rules are for individuals or teams to try to guess the film with the first person making it to 20 points winning.  Variant rules are provided.  The end of the game is decided before the game begins.

Name: Barking Spiders: The Game
Description:
Finally, a game that combines the best parts of Phase 10 (forming movements; dropping kids off at the pool) with UNO (skipping opponents; making “number one” jokes) while eliminating all the lame parts (keeping score, needing to learn Spanish, foregoing scatological humor).

Here's how it works: Use Clumps, Streaks and Flushes to form your best movements out of Mass or Gas cards. Once your movement is complete, be the first player to drop your kids off at the pool to finish the hand. Now get to work on your next movement. You have to pass five movements but you can do them in any order. See? Easy.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Family
Description:
The Family is a 2-4 player tabletop card game, putting YOU in the shoes of a crime boss.

Pit yourself against your friends and family and see who comes on top as the best crime boss. You’ll need to draw from the deck,  place associates on locations and eliminate your rivals to gain control of your turf and win. Be ruthless, or you will not succeed. Be ruthless, or you will not succeed.

It’s turn based, you each get a turn in order, however some strategic bonuses you earn will allow you a second turn, such as attacking after you’ve drawn cards.

Turn types:
Draw cards for nifty ways to make your position better or maybe worse (a gamble worth taking most of the time).
Attack rivals using dice when you’ve gained the right strategic advantages.
Command locations to receive strategic bonuses.
Reinforce locations you occupy to ensure success.

Name: Light Castle
Description:
Three warriors must save 4 keepers of the castle of light who have turned into evil monsters, and they must try to maintain as many towers to get high scores in their mission.

The gameplay is simple, during 7 rounds any player rolls 5 dice, 2 of them will activate the effects of the managers that can be to destroy towers, bring fog to the towers, among others, then with the 3 remaining dice you can organize their values â€‹â€‹in one or more rows of actions of the warriors, and thus obtain bonuses in diamonds also complete a row that will give you many points, but you must organize them as more consecutively as possible or if you cannot be blocked, these actions range from increasing your attack, increasing your movements through the castle towers, mushrooms to control luck, placing books on the towers and incredible powers among others.

At any time you can exchange diamonds with the ghost merchant for useful objects, if it is in solo mode the player must beat a certain score to win, or if there are several players, the player with the most points wins the game by: putting books together, delivering potions to those in charge, for towers that are not destroyed, but there must be a minimum of 2 fog figures, for completed rows among other scores.

—description from the designer

Name: Temerity
Description:
2 player strategy game with the objective to deal the highest attack before the cards run out. Players use cards either face up or face down to achieve their goal.

Players play 1 or more cards from their hand and can optionally reveal a face down card placed on a previous turn.

When the cards in the deck runs out, the game ends and the player who performed the highest attack during the game is the winner.

Name: Penalty Challenge: Teams
Description:
This is a "Teams" version of the former "Penalty Challenge" game. In this version every player will be dealt a complete team of 11 players, with a similar set of shooting directions and star players.

Players will also be given specific goalkeeper gloves to manage during the game, so in this version the goalkeeper will have a more strategic role and in every shot the defending team will decide whether to wait to see the shot direction or to risk moving to one direction and be able to use a neutral glove and occupy more goal spaces.

The mechanism is the same as in "Penalty Challenge" the original game, the team shooting will put a shooting card pointing at the intended goal and after the defending team place their goalkeeper the shooter will be revealed. If the goalkeeper guesses the direction, they will put gloves to cover the circles inside the goal. Those circles has numbers and the shooter needs to choose one empty circle and roll the die to match with one of the number of that circle. If that happens it will be a goal, otherwise the shot will be blocked.

First team obtaining 5 goals will be the winner of the game!

Name: Mugrugni
Description:
A game of battles and conquests in which only Mugrugni can be heard.

In this board game perfect for an evening with friends, you will lead one of the five tribes of wild boars to conquer the 40 districts of Genoa. You can choose the Sciacaeli, the Scignuri, the Beline, the Besughi and the Legere to defeat your enemies with cards, dice, strategy and ... fangs!  Immerse yourself in a game of conquests and battles where only your skill as a strategist will determine the winner.

During his turn, the player moves his boar armies to take possession of the districts under the control of the opponents.
Battles are resolved by rolling dice and using cards to help the attack succeed. The player who manages to conquer all the territories designated for him at the beginning of the game or the player who has scored the most points wins

(Publisher's description)

Name: Cabbage Farm
Description:
In Cabbage Farm, you collect and deliver cabbages to complete target cards. To do this, you use your worker to maximize the chance of collecting harvested cabbage. Players are allowed to steal coins and cabbages by using Lampy and Cukoo (that is, actions that allow you to move the chicken and sheep) to be placed in the same spot as another player.

Players play as cabbage farmers trying to collect the harvested cabbages on the farm according to the order(s) received from the Target Card. Completing each order will gain points. On each turn, players can play Action Card, place work on Move Card and Complete Target Card. Points are scored for each completed Target Card, a pair of cabbage accumulates 3 points while 1 cabbage equals 1 point (these points apply at the end of the game in must be present in your hand excluding the cabbages used for Target Card) and 1 coin accounts for 1 point. The player with the most points wins.

Cabbage Farm is an ward winning board game design competition in Thailand. It was published in 2021 by Aroi Games. Cabbage Farm is family board game where you can enjoy farming cabbages with children and adult.

Name: Taboo Junior / Outburst Jr
Description: Taboo Junior and Outburst Junior in one box.
Families: Versions & Editions: Junior Versions of Grown-Up Games

Name: Kayros: A Game of Thieves
Description:
The god Kayros has summoned all the best thieves from every age to confront each other in a great tournament that will establish, once and for all, who is the greatest thief in each universe. To win, Robin Hood, Arsène Lupin and the other thieves will have to travel through time and space to steal the world's most precious treasures.

"Kayros: A Game of Thieves" is a board game for 2-6 players (1v1, 2v2, 3v3, 2v2v2, or free-for-all).

Each player leads a Thief with unique abilities and statistics.

The game is played in turns, and at the end of each turn, players draw 2 cards from the Main Deck consisting of Tool and Event cards and earn 1 coin.

Tool cards are used to provide additional abilities and increase the Thief's statistics, while Event cards have an immediate effect and also contain objectives that, if completed, provide Victory Points. With Coins, players can buy Silver and Gold Tools, cards that will greatly enhance your character!

The main goal of the game is to steal the Treasures placed in the center of the table, but it is not the only way to win the game. In fact, many different factors contribute to Victory Points.

The game comes to an end when a player fills their Loot or steals two sets of Treasures (a set consists of three treasures of the same type). The final "special" turn is executed, and Victory Points are counted!

Name: La Campaña del Peón
Description:
La Campaña del Peón is a print & play roll-and-write game by Yovosgalo, in a campaign with weekly episodic adventures.


OBJECTIVE
Collect the most points in the campaign.

SETUP
In the game sheet you must identify the location of the pawn (Red) of your campaign.

FLOW OF THE GAME
In each turn you must throw the dice, each face of the die is a reference to each of the Chess pieces. The pawn must always move forward, one movement each turn.


Pawns dream, the lowest class of chess society has dreams of glory, they deeply yearn to triumph in battle. And when they rest their head on the pillow, they first dream of not being condemned to the straight lift of the board, not being condemned not to step back.

They fully yearn to be a splendid lady who gloats over the entire board full of pirouettes, they dream of stepping on sectors far from their initial jump in long straight runs or endless diagonals that cross the checkerboard, they dream of drawing equine jumps from here to there, with that rare zigzag that only they come out, they dream of being the king, who is allowed to think, rethink and take short steps towards any of the 4 cardinal points.

Every night our pawn dreams that he devours the entire board visiting the most remote squares, and while he goes through them he gathers fragments of his dreams that sparkle the warrior soul of the bravest of the board's dreamers.

Name: 2 von 4: Hol sie Dir!
Description:
The somewhat different dice game, 4 dice, game instructions and XL game block with 150 sheets in a slipcase.

A fast and exciting dice game for the whole family. The basic principle is simple: Whoever fills out his game sheet completely and collects the most points wins!

In each round, only one player rolls the dice, but the other players are also allowed to take 2 out of 4 of the numbers rolled. But only the player who rolls the dice is allowed to fill in the number on the red dice.

Caution: "2 out of 4" is addictive! Therefore, in addition to the dice and the game instructions, a huge XL game block with 150 sheets is included! And now get to the dice when it's time: 2 out of 4 - Get it!

Name: ¡Con Café!
Description:
¡Bienvenidos a la Panadería! Welcome to the Mexican Bakery!
The fresh pan dulce in that display case looks delicious! Who will take home the best combination of pastries from the panadería?

Take turns filling up trays with combinations of sweet bread, one or two cards at a time. When a tray looks too delicious to pass up, take it! You must decide whether to take a tray or push your luck by holding off and adding more cards to the trays on the table. Take the tray that will give you the best scoring combinations to earn the most points.
But not so fast: The last player to take a tray earns a cup of coffee - and a bonus action, ¡con café!
At the end of the game, add up the combined score of all your pan dulce to determine the winner.
Every round you play goes better ¡con café!

The object of the game is to collect sets of cards that will score the most points.
Divide the deck into four stacks of pan dulce cards, face up, forming the display case. Each round begins by placing one tray per player in the center of the table.   
On your turn, you may select one or two cards from the display case and place them onto one or two trays that are not yet full. Or, instead of adding more cards, you may take one of the trays and all of the cards it contains. You place those cards in front of you, and then pass for the remainder of the round. When only one tray remains on your turn, you must take it (no matter how full it is), but you also select a café card that grants a bonus action.
After three rounds, each player scores the combination of cards they have taken throughout the game, and the player with the highest score is the winner!

Name: Raid! Word Game
Description:
Have you ever been stuck at a game night waiting and waiting for others to take their turn? Or played word games where the only words that came to mind are BORED or RAGE? What if you took that RAGE, built it back and made it GREAT? RAID's unique gameplay brings everyone together!

RAID is a fast-paced party game for players of all ages - it's great for adults who love word games and are uber-competitive, as well as more casual players and kids. There's even a second board on the reverse side where it’s easier to form words. RAID is perfect to encourage children to have fun with words and you get TWO games in ONE BOX!

One player rolls the dice and takes the number of letters indicated on the dice from the bag and places them face up in the circle for everyone to see. At a quick pace the next player does the same. As soon as any letters are in the circle, it’s everyone’s turn. To form a word you take letters from the circle. The first player to shout out a word grabs the letters and fits them on their board in one of their rows.

Anyone can steal or RAID any word from another player's board by combining it with one or more letters from the circle to form a new word. Note: the new word has to have a completely new meaning to be a valid RAID. New letters are constantly being added so be sure to look out for new opportunities on your road to victory.

There are several ways to win:
Be the first player to complete three rows in your field.
Be the player with the most points after a pre-agreed time limit.
Be the player with the most points after all the letters tiles have been drawn.

The RAID App is here for everyone and you can download it on your phone, tablet or personal computer right now!

Name: La Casa de Papel: Escape Game 2
Description:
After your sensational robbery of the Spanish banknote printing house, you now face a new challenge!
You have a double goal: steal the gold reserves of the Spanish National Bank and free Rio. Again the professor will guide you. So follow his instructions - and you will be rich and free!

Name: Loyalty or Liberty?
Description:
An exciting and replayable DBG and War Game, combined!

It is the late seventeen seventies and the American War of Independence is in full swing. As cannons roar and muskets crackles across the east coast of the North American continent, armies of the Crown and Rebellion clash, and a decisive victory hangs in the balance.

Take command of one or more of as many as seven factions, each with their own traits and advantages as they vie for supremacy in a hypothetical scenario where terrain and unit lists change with each playthrough. Seize the initiative and dominate the field using a unique "Deployment" and "Lady Luck" card-driven system. Master the unique abilities of numerous officers and manipulate events across the battlefields, all while guiding myriad types of troops through varying terrain to victory, achieved by defeating the enemy on the field and raiding their base. Will the French rout the Germans from the field? Will the Loyalists tenaciously hold the line against their fellow Americans in a civil war of their own? Will the Spanish set out to dominate the Natives? Will Britannia reign supreme? It’s up to you, your opponent, and the dice and cards to find out!

Name: Trick Gear: Persona 5 The Royal
Description:
A fast paced, action, battle royale game where you face off against 1 to 3 opponents incorporating characters from the Persona video game's universe and power them up using any standard 54 deck of playing cards! Activate special skills and be the last one standing to win!

Players take turns drafting heroes (from the 17 character cards included in the box) that they will use to battle their opponents. Each player shuffles a 54 card standard playing card deck (sold separately) and draws a starting hand equal to the value printed on their current character. They also draw cards equal to that character's LIFE value. Players will then pick one card from their hand to represent their starting POWER (1-10 cards have power equivalent to their numbers, while Jacks, Queens and Kings equal a power value of 11,12 and 13 respectively).

Players then take turns playing different suits and numbered cards in specific combinations to activate their character's own unique battle skills. These skills will either allow you to charge up your current battle power value even further, increase the rate of damage dealt to losing players at the end of the round, or any number of special abilities (like drawing more cards or dealing instant damage to an opponent).

Once all players PASS, everyone counts up who has the current highest power value. That player wins that round, dealing damage to every other player, equivalent to the current rate of damage! Those players must discard life cards equal to the damage rate. If a hero loses all of it's health, that player must switch to one of their reserve heroes. When all of your opponents heroes have been reduced to 0 health, you win the game!

Name: Are You More Like
Description:
Are You More Like is a hilarious party game that lets you see just how well your friends and family know you! (It is also a fantastic get to know you game for a first date)

First the Active Player is selected. Then, all other players look at their cards in hand and choose a number of cards to play face down in the middle based on the Quick Start Chart. Then if needed, add cards from the deck until there are at least 5 cards in the middle (again see the Quick Start Chart).

After all cards are submitted, the Active Player mixes the cards up and turns them over face up and puts them in a row. The Active Player will then secretly choose from the options which one they personally are “Most Like” AND which one they are “Least Like” and write it down. (Note: This is NOT which one do you like the most? It is which one are you most like?) At the same time all other players are secretly writing down what they predict the active player will choose for Most and Least about themselves.

Once all players have made their decisions, all non-active players reveal their choices at the same time by placing their (Most Token) and (Least Token) below each of the respectively chosen cards. The Active Player will then place their (Most Token) and (Least Token) above each respectively chosen card. After points are awarded, discard the cards from the middle, everyone restocks their hand to five cards and the next player become the Active Player.

The points needed to win varies on based on number of players.

Name: Сибирь. Начало. (Siberia: The Beginning)
Description:
Siberia. The Beginning is a game for 2-4 players who are interested in being in the role of the conqueror of Siberia in the 18th century. Explore new territories with your squad, find treasures, build churches and forts, establish settlements and fight enemies! Become a real ruler of the Siberian land!

Taking turns exposing from the starting field and mastering the tiles of the map of the lands of Siberia, the players move their meeples along it so that their location on the map objects meets the requirements of various tasks. At the end of each turn, the player must try to complete one or more tasks of his choice.
Each completed mission earns the player victory points.

The winner of the game is the one who scores the most points at the end of the game - and proves his right to rule the Siberian land.

Name: Hong Kong (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
Description:
Ticket to Ride™: Hong Kong is a fan-made expansion to the Days of Wonder, Inc. Ticket to Ride™ series created by Alan R. Moon. A tribute both to Ticket to Ride™ and to Hong Kong, this expansion is designed for players who are already well familiar with Ticket to Ride™’s standard gameplay and mechanics.

Published by permission for non-commercial use. All rights to the Ticket to Ride name, gameplay, mechanics, and imagery are reserved by Days of Wonder, Inc., who have not endorsed or play tested this expansion.

Name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus -Taïs
Description: The Taïs expansion puts a focus on the Deviant faction of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, the option to play with a 5th player and 4 scenarios for Deviants. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one deviant character, Taïs.

Name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus – Etho
Description: The Etho expansion puts a focus on the Theocrate faction of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, the option to play with a 5th player and 4 scenarios for Theocrates. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one Theocrat character, Etho.

Name: Seeders from Sereis: Exodus – Hank's
Description: The Hank's expansion introduces the new Quincailleurs class of Sereïs. It adds asymmetric gameplay, 26 new Ark cards and 4 scenarios that use them. A booklet tells an episode from the life of one Quincailleur character, Hank.

Name: Final Challenge: Twisted Expansion
Description: Twisted expansion contains challenges, scenarios and art that is weird, unusual and out of the ordinary. There will be magic, creativity, fantasy and just plain bizarre moments that will make you scratch your head.

Name: Dreimal Darfst Du Raten
Description:
Dreimal Darfst Du Raten (english you got three guesses) is a entertaining game and is played with teams of at least two members.

Players take turns to describe a specific phrase to their partners until the stack of 20 cards is divided to the team that correctly guessed. After the points are noted, the 20 cards are shuffled together to start another round with different ruling up to three rounds.

First Round:
Only use words, expect words that are in the phrase, to describe the phrases.

Second Round:
Only use gestures to describe the phrases.

Third Round:
Only use sounds to describe the phrases.

The team with the most guesses in summed in all rounds win.

Name: Final Challenge: Rated R
Description: Hide the kids, hide the elderly, send the easily offended and sensitive friends back home, because the content of the Rated R expansion really packs a punch. It’s cringe worthy, hilarious, and borderline unmanageable.

Name: Das Quiz der Erde
Description: In this quiz game, each player gets 7 question cards from 7 categories. The answers are contained in an enclosed book. The player whose turn it is reads out one of his questions and must answer it himself (according to the specification on the card) or address it to all the players. Correctly answered individual questions score 1 point, the general questions score 2 points. The player who scores the most points wins the game.

Name: Meeple Hope
Description:
It's the end of the world! Your planet MEEPLE EARTH is dying. After years of exploiting its last resources, your people (the Meeples) are headed for extinction. In order to survive this they have created the Meeple Hope program as a last resort. Several rockets are sent into space, allowing a few lucky ones to survive and search of a new home. Today the last Meeple Hope rocket is ready to take off, but unfortunately there won't be room for everyone. All bets are off in the boarding line to try to get aboard the rocket and leave the dying planet.

Try to get all your meeples into the rocket before your opponents. The first player to get all his meeples into the rocket wins the game! To do this, players must take turns, using cards, to try to predict how the queue will progress. Each player has identical cards, so you will be able to apprehend or constrain the movements of your opponents.

The game plays roughly like Colt Express: each player has the same six cards in hand, at their turn, they play one card (face up) on the Programming Deck. Once each player has played three cards, these cards are revealed one by one and resolved. The players do the same with their three remaining cards. They get their six cards back and begin a new round if the end of game condition is not met.

A player wins if they are the first to reach the rocket with all their meeples.

Solo mode included: Program against a virtual player
Program character configurations in the waiting line, in successive challenges.

Name: Mein Königreich für ein Pferd: Promokarten
Description:
Three German promo cards for Mein Königreich für ein Pferd:

- Life finds a way: Give away 1 pig. Everyone must remove 1 fence from their pasture. You may not move/swap your animals to other areas beforehand. Unfenced animals run away immediately.
- Be a pig!: You may re-roll 1 die one additional time in the dice phase of your turn, after you have already executed it. However, you cannot execute it again.
- Swine mess/Swinishness: You may re-roll as many dice as you like in the dice phase of your turn after you have already executed them. However, you cannot execute them again



The original cards in German 
- Das Leben findet einen Weg: Gib 1 Schwein ab. Alle müssen 1 Zaun von ihrer Weide entfernen. Ihr dürft eure Tiere vorher nicht in andere Bereiche versetzen/tauschen. Nicht eingezäunte Tiere laufen sofort weg.
- Sei ein Schwein!: Du darfst in der Würfelphase deines Zugs 1 Würfel 1x zusätzlich nachwürfeln, nachdem du ihn bereits ausgeführt hast. Du kannst ihn jedoch nicht erneut ausführen.
- Schweinerei: Du darfst in der Würfelphase deines Zugs beliebig viele Würfel nachwürfeln, nachdem du sie bereits ausgeführt hast. Du kannst sie jedoch nicht erneut ausführen

Name: Para bellum: Pars I
Description:
The first of three parts of the board game Scharz. The game includes two maps (Britannia and Italia), four-player game sets (469 wooden components in total) and four game modes (fast, basic, original and extended). The game is combinable with the other two parts (and therefore for up to 12 players).
The English version 0.99 can be still purchased at scharz.com.
The latest files for version 0.99 can be found at scharz.com or https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/287893/scharz
Kickstarter campaign: https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/scharz/scharz
Official website: https://scharz.com/

Name: Para bellum: Pars II
Description:
The second of three parts of the board game Scharz. The game includes two maps (Vikings and Taifas), four-player game sets (469 wooden components in total) and four game modes (fast, basic, original and extended). The game is combinable with the other two parts (and therefore for up to 12 players).
The English version 0.99 can be still purchased at scharz.com.
The latest files for version 0.99 can be found at scharz.com or https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/287893/scharz

Name: Get Bit! Feeding Frenzy: The Sharkspansion
Description:
Get Bit! Feeding Frenzy: The Sharkspansion expands Get Bit! in two ways:

• Item cards: Players can use items that have been lost at sea to get away from the shark — or at least get away from the other players.

• Shark cards: Instead of mindlessly chomping on the last swimmer in the line, the shark is now a playable character. Can you outthink the others to keep your belly full?

Name: Para bellum: Pars III
Description:
The third of three parts of the board game Scharz. The game includes two maps (Huns and Orient), four-player game sets (469 wooden components in total) and four game modes (fast, basic, original and extended). The game is combinable with the other two parts (and therefore for up to 12 players).
The English version 0.99 can be still purchased at scharz.com.
The latest files for version 0.99 can be found at scharz.com or https://boardgamegeek.com/boardgame/287893/scharz

Name: Treeblox
Description:
Treeblox is an abstract strategy board game in which two trees compete for sunlight in three-dimensional space.

The game starts with an empty board. Players then take turns placing cubes that represent leaves and branches. Unshaded leaves — that is, leaves that are visible when the board is viewed from above — count as active and supply their tree with energy to grow further. Your goal is to shade your opponent's leaves while keeping your own leaves open to the sun.

Each player starts with one leaf in a space on the 4x4 game board. On a turn, if you have 1-2 unshaded leaves, you place one piece on the board, whether a branch or a leaf; if you have three or more unshaded leaves, then you place up to two pieces. You can place nothing in a leaf, so a leaf serves as an endpoint for growth. If you place a branch, however, then you can add a branch or a leaf to any available side of that branch. You can have multiple branches growing on the game board, and the branches and leaves can extend outside of the 4x4 game board. If you build high enough, you can shade an opponent's leaves.

When a player has placed their final piece, whether because they've placed everything or they have no legal placements available, the other player goes through a "final growth" phase in which they place everything they can. At that point, whoever has the most unshaded leaves wins. If you ever have zero unshaded leaves during play, you lose immediately.

Name: Hibachi: Fried Egg promo
Description:
Each round, before players throw any chips onto the board, the current head chef throws the egg chip onto the board. Then players will begin throwing their chips on the board as normal, starting with the head chef.

Any chips sitting on the same spot as the egg at the commencement of the Cleaning the Cooking Area phase are removed from the board and the space is not resolved this round!

Name: Rival Rogues
Description:
As a talented and devious rogue you know that this high level job requires the best equipment. Gather the necessary materials, but be quick! Or someone else will beat you to the treasure!

Create your equipment by combining needed materials, but watch out for the monsters and trap cards hiding in the material deck! Be the first to craft 3 equipment cards and maintain the most points by the end of the round to win the game.

On the start of your turn you have three actions to complete: Draw 1 Card from any three decks ; Play 1 action card ; Play your subclass ; Complete an equipment card.

The last round of the game is started when a person plays their third equipment card, symbolizing their desire to complete the job. The game ends on the turn of the person who went last on the starting round.

To win the game and complete the job, be the first to complete 3 equipment cards and maintain the most points by the end of the round! Points are +1 for each complete equipment card and an additional +1 for every special equipment that matches your role.

If the player only completes two cards and ties in points with the person that ended the game, the person who ended the game wins. All other ties are settled by an added speed round. The top equipment card is flipped up and the tied players take turns as normal trying to complete that equipment card. Resolve Monsters, Traps, and other actions cards as normal, but remove the equipment and role deck.

Name: Growers and Showers
Description:
What do you get if you combine Exploding Kittens with Cards Against Humanity and Bears Vs Babies?

Growers and Showers is a tactical card game about sex and relationships. The decks are full of inappropriate cards, from porn categories and contraceptives to sexual orientations and kinks. Players use these cards to grow the biggest Dick, before their friend cuts it off!

As the game intensifies, players have to choose whether they want to use their cards to grow a bigger Dick early and protect it (Showers) or slowly catch up and steal a win at the last (Growers). Once the Decks are depleted, the game ends and the biggest Dick wins.

A turn consists of 2 moves. On a move, you play a card from your hand and discard it in the process. These moves can consist of 1 card or more depending on the type of card. Hands must be replenished between moves, so that every hand has the minimum number of cards (7).

When all the cards are depleted from the Decks, the game ends immediately.

Initially, a player will have to have the biggest Grower. If the Missionary cards have been played during the game then the aim of the game could have been changed to smallest Grower or most cards on your Grower.

Name: Santa Monica: Fox Games Promo Card
Description:
A special card representing the Polish publisher's office available when ordering the Polish edition directly from Fox Games.

Card has no text but does include icons and values at the bottom right.

Name: El Mundo Oscuro: Expansión Oscura
Description:
10 cards with which players will create deadly combinations with unexpected results. It is used to have more cards and to be able to play modalities such as EXPERT, VERSUS and RANDOM.

With this expansion you will experience masterful plays, experience how the game grows and mutates ... change a card in the deck, change the game ... Swap cards, customize your deck and you will experience a fantastic and fun competition.

Nuevos Bufones (Descarta 4 / Revela y Pierde) 
Dark Gangster 
Sibila Oscura 
Bruja Oscura 
Nuevos Popes (Utiliza / Cancela)
Senadores (Toma 1)
Emperador Oscuro 
Emperatriz Oscura

Name: El Mundo Oscuro: Expansión Limitada
Description:
If you liked the Dark Expansion, these new cards are for you ... Surprise your opponent with these unique cards totally out of series for their new mechanics and effects.

Decide to play more cards in any turn just by REVEALING THEM, creating new combinations and plays that will put pressure on your rivals with new and infamous actions.

Nuevo Bufón (Elige 1 / Comodín / Juega 1 / Cancela todo)
Nuevo Gangster Oscuro
Nueva Sibila Oscura
Nueva Bruja
Nuevo Pope (Revela / Saltea) 
Nuevo Senadores 
Nuevo Emperador Oscuro 
Nueva Emperatriz Oscura 
Caín Oscuro 
Lilith Oscura.

Name: U.S. Civil War: 3CP
Description:
March 4th, 1861. In his inaugural address, President Abraham Lincoln promises not to invade the south or curtail slavery as long as tariffs are collected there and forwarded to the federal government. The south secedes from the Union nonetheless. Lincoln won’t let it go, however, and attempts to reinforce Fort Sumter (in his view still federal property) in Confederate South Carolina, provoking the south into firing the first shots. Its cannons level the fort, albeit without loss of life. War fever in the north is at its zenith, and the stage is set – for the U.S. Civil War.

During this game you’ll compete for cards representing Infantry, Artillery, Cavalry and Generals – by playing hands of 3-card poker. (Hence, “3CP” in the game’s title.) However, since this is more or less a friendly competition, the “pots” are not winner-take-all. Instead, the winner of a round will gain two components, while his/her opponent will gain one – and it’s the winner’s decision. Close attention to your needs and those of your opponent is required. Your goal is, ideally, to build four Brigades, each with a General and Supplies, and perhaps one additional Brigade if you’re lucky. Card management in the form of “what poker hand to play now and what to save for later” is also an important factor toward winning the game.

This is the third game in a series using the 3CP Game Engine™, which employs custom cards and a deck of standard playing cards.

Name: Shake & Make
Description:
A quick shake changes the position of the dice.  Play solo, or take turns to play heat to head with a friend.

Shake & Make is a  pure-luck game that is contained entirely in a single small plastic dome.  Shake the dome and 4 dice fall into slots to display 4 random numbers.  A rulebook (attached to the bottom of the dome) summarized different patterns, mostly following Yahtzee/Poker pattern rankings.  Play solo for the best combination or competitively by comparing to see who rolled the best pattern.

Take turns to see who can get the best score - Highest total, 1 pair, 2 pair, straight, 3-of-a-kind, 4-of-a-kind...

Do you have the luck to shake and make the best roll?

Name: The Big Six game box
Description: Bundle of six family/party card games. Each deck has about a hundred cards. Included are "Battle of the Ages" (Kids v Grown-ups trivia, "The Big Quiz" (Basic trivia), "Charades", "Mimic the Music" (a capella humming Name That Tune), "Impossible Decisions" (Would you rather do/have this or that? - both suck), "Who Am I?" (Think Inglorious Basterds bar scene). Included are minute timer, headbands for "Who Am I?" and rule sheet for all six games.

Name: Board Royale: The Island – Wild Hunt Expansion Pack
Description:
The creatures of K.R.A.K.E.N. Industries escaped from their cages and they are hungry. Fighting side-by-side with other survivors and cooperating with them is your only choice. Hunt or be hunted!

This expansion turns competitive Board Royale gameplay into a cooperative strategic experience. Face against deadly creatures, team up with other survivors and animal companions, strategize your plan, fight for your life, and defeat bosses! If anyone dies, the game is over!

Name: MadJack
Description:
MadJack is a trick-taking game for two players that has two phases.  During the first phase, players juggle capturing tricks and building their hand for the second phase.  For the second phase of the game, players have the opportunity to capture Prize Cards that will be a huge help in winning the round.

Be wary of the wily Jacks. They will change rank depending on the card that leads the trick or the Prize Card that is up for grabs during the second phase.  The player who wins the most cards during the round earns points, and the first person to earn 10 points wins the game.

Name: Gods and Heroes
Description:
A fast-paced Battle card game, with Drafting and in-game Deck-Building for 2 players (4 player rules can be added via stretch goals!).

Gods and Heroes is a battle of strength and prestige between warring Gods and their subjects. Build Temples of worship to bolster your armies and weaken your foes. Let loose your mightiest Heroes and crush your enemies in the name of your chosen Deity!

Each player represents a God, or Goddess fighting for dominion over the Lost Realm. Players draw and play cards to attack the other Temple Guardians. Once all a player's temple guardians are destroyed, a player loses the game.

Victory goes to the one who destroys all enemy Temple Guardians. Alternatively, whoever cannot discard three cards during a reshuffle, loses.

Name: Muerte Subita
Description:
If you like to have fun with card games, as easy to learn as UNO, you will love this game, it is very easy and fun.

Each player starts with 5 lives (sets). Every turn, the player has to put a card on the center trying not to pass 21. Players count the numbers on their cards and, if they are more than 21, you lose one of your 5 sets.  If a player loses all 5 sets (lives), they are eliminated from the game.  The winner is the last player in the game.

Cards have a Tennis theme.

Name: Dungeoneers: Silver City
Description:
This expansion will provide details regarding your heroes visits to Silver City. You can now visit the guilds and buy profession specific equipment, visit the fortune teller, choose a bank to care for your money or take on side quest parallel to you primary quest. There is even more equipment added, including 10 new potions. You can earn money by participating in horse racing, gambling or by fighting in the arena. Finally, you can spend your hard earned money on an estate which you and your party can use as a base. As time goes, you can improve this base to prepare yourself even better for the coming quests.

—description from the designer

Name: Arena: The Contest – Tanares RPG
Description:
Welcome to Tanares, a high-fantasy campaign setting for the 5th Edition of the world’s greatest roleplaying game. With almost 1,000 pages, the book set features an abundantly detailed world, four unique, bold, extensively playtested new classes, four original races, hundreds of unique illustrations, and hundreds of subclasses, spells, feats, and backgrounds — plus more. Working also as an expansion to Arena: The Contest and Tanares Adventures, you can experience the power of these new features as new classes, sub-classes, and races as the miniatures also come with everything you need to play them on our board games too.

Behold the majesty of the new Gold Dragon and the new, fearsome Penumbral Dragon, ready for the fight on Boss Vs. Boss mode, found on the Dragon Collection Expansion. Meet the warlords from Arena: The Contest, in new, exclusive miniatures, complete with new cards. Face the terror of the new foes from the Penumbral Plane and complete your 3d scenery collection with the new Scenario Pack.

In Tanares, whenever war was waged, the bloodshed summoned a powerful, frenzied Dragon that buried the civilizations involved, resetting History and forever changing the landscape. This dystopian world is kept together and on a short leash by an Empire that forbids large armed gatherings. Under this decree, and without many high-level adventurers out there, your Team may become one of the most powerful units in the world. Build an Adventure Team Sheet, earn Career Points and level up, design a headquarters and flag.

Effect real change to all aspects of the scenario, be it with your 5E party or through the Solo Mode, a 300+ card deck that lets 1-4 players live and play the Adventure without a GM! Become a Hero, change the world's fate, and take your game to the next level.

Name: War of the Worlds: The New Wave – German promo cards
Description:
Six German promocards for War of the Worlds: The New Wave:

     Dog Scout
     Spyder (Spinne)
     Bombardment (Bombardierung)
     Orbital Strike (Angriff aus dem Orbit)
     Draw Energy (Energie saugen)
     Tesla (Tesla)
Families: Books: The War of the Worlds

Name: Battle Havoc!
Description:
Battle Havoc! is easy to learn and play fantasy wargame where each player commands an army and lead it to the victory on the battlefields. Thanks to alternative activation, all players are involved continuously in action.

Each unit represents up to a few hundreds of men and the game doesn’t have any particular scale, as players can choose to play with either 28mm or 10mm miniatures.

Fight big battles with just a handful miniatures!

—description from the publisher

Name: Krimispiel: Tod in Tillstetten
Description:
Take on the investigative work in an exciting criminal case!
Follow the clues. Who has a motive? Are the alibis correct?
Excitement and fun with numerous hints. 
For some of the research you need access to the internet.
You are forming a special commission to investigate a murder. The previous police investigations have not been successful.

The police headquarters finally needs progress, and therefore sent you the order to take over the investigation. With the order you will receive the investigation results found so far for the case in an envelope.

The group of potential perpetrators has already been narrowed down somewhat. Now your creativity and a sense of crime is required.

Work your way through the evidence and clues discovered so far, do research.

Do suspects have alibis and are out of the question for the crime? Who is the perpetrator?

Examine the various clues, discuss in the group what motives the suspects might have had to commit a murder. Who has something to hide?

It is best if your special commission consists of 2-7 players to determine together. The game can also be played solo.

You can be creative and use tools during the investigation. Research on the Internet may also be necessary to track down the perpetrator.

Name: Unsere Wehrmacht im Manöver: Rot Gegen Blau
Description:
Unsere Wehrmacht im Manover Rot Gegen Blau ("Our Army in Maneuver, Red vs. Blue") is a tiddlywinks type board game about the First World War.
On the box cover (artist Hans Friedmann, Munchen) - army cavalry men and horses are galloping from right rear to left front, while infantry marches at upper left below trees.
The trifold game board depicts a military scene with blue forces on the left fighting gray forces on the right. A footbridge is shown at center near the top. At center is a sturdy bridge with a tank on its way to cross it. Below that, troops are crossing the river in a raft. Near bottom, troops are building a wooden bridge across the river.

It is a competitive game involving to teams (players) in red and blue color. Player are fighting on the game board with different type of measures: horses, tanks, aircrafts, cannons etc. Players, who lose all measures lose the game.

—user summary

Name: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai: Moonlight Whispers
Description:
Expansion for Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai
- 2 New Asymmetric Clans : Tanuki & Kappa
- New Abilities : Change and Hide
- The Whisper Islands

There are legends, even among the Yokai, of beings so unique and powerful that even the Yokai King himself could neither control nor banish them. The Daiyokai, whose names should never be uttered aloud, are enigmatic creatures. But beware, for they have their own agendas and are loyal to no one.

The Whisper Island Tiles represent the mysterious archipelago where the Daiyokai dwell. Each of
these Island Tiles is governed by two elements; however, you must still abide by the rule that forbids
you from placing more than 1 Meeple on each Island Tile during a single turn.

Name: Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai: Kami Rising
Description:
Expansion for Night Parade of a Hundred Yokai
- 2 New Asymmetric Clans : Kotengu, Inugami
- 2 New Yokai Abilities : Banish & Invoke

The Kami Rising expansion includes: 
- 20 Painted Meeples
- 10 Torii Meeples
- 48 Yokai cards
- 4 Hidden Plots
- 9 Kami Cards
- 16 tokens (8 Invoke, 8 Banish).
